result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan Michael Stack was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan Michael Stack

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
8:36 AM Defendant Ryan Michael Stack in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jacob S Gondik in court for Ryan Michael Stack. Attorney acknowledges receipt of the information, waives a formal reading, and are ready to enter into plea. State recites agreement. Defendant will plead to the sole count with a sentence of 18 days jail with credit for 18 days (time served), and payment of mandatory court costs. 
Defendant pleads no contest to the sole count. Attorney Gondik stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the defendant's plea and finds that the plea has been knowingly and voluntarily made. Court finds the defendant guilty. 
Court orders a sentence of 18 days jail with credit for 18 days (time served) and payment of mandatory costs. 
Court reviews 21CF486 and upcoming motion hearing to terminated DJOC in that file. Defendant will sign notice for that hearing.
Exhibit 1 from preliminary hearing  - certified bond sheet from 21CF486

11:31 AM Defendant Ryan Michael Stack in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State calls witness, Officer David Dalbec, S/T. State-direct examination of witness. October 6, 2022/Jimmy's Saloon, City of Superior, Douglas County Wisconsin. Witness identifies Defendant, no objection by defendant. Record reflects identification of defendant.
Defendant has no questions. Court questions witness. Exhibit 1 marked. Exhibit 1 shown to defendant. State moves for admission of Exhibit 1 (certified bond sheet), no objection. Exhibit 1 received. State asks court to take judicial notice of bond conditions of no alcohol. Court takes judicial notice. State rests. 
State makes argument for bind over. Defendant has no testimony to offer. Court finds probable cause and binds the Defendant over for Arraignment. 
Court reminds the Defendant of their bail conditions. Defendant orally confirms they have received date and time of hearing and confirms they will attend. Defendant provided notice.
Defendant requests bail modification. $5000 unattainable. Was out prior on a $2000 bond and made all of his court dates. Requests $2,000 cash bail. 
State notes concerned with 21CF486 in that he is on a deferred agreement in that file and has already violated it. Thinks bond set is appropriate.
Defendant notes state originally recommended $2,000 cash bond at initial hearing. 
Court makes statements. Court suggests defendant makes bail mod before Judge Glonek.
Arraignment scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

1:34 PM Defendant Ryan Michael Stack appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Peter Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court questions defendant on status of attorney.
Defendant indicates $5000cb is unattainable and is requesting a bail reduction.
Court questions what defendant on what he has done to obtain an attorney.  Defendant states the PD's office told him he does not qualify.
Attorney Hoffman-confirms that defendant does not qualify for public defender.
Defendant requesting bail reduction; seeking $2000cb.
Court reviews history and questions intention for preliminary hearing; let's defendant know he can waive time limits for preliminary hearing to have more time to work on getting an attorney before going to evidentiary hearing. Defendant again requests bail reduction.  Court states she will not be giving a bail reduction today; the bail was set by the judge and no motion for modification was filed.
Defendant asks for court appointed attorney; court lets defendant know if he's comfortable letting her know on the record she would be able to let him know if he qualifies. Defendant gives yearly income and Court is certain he will not qualify for court appointed attorney.
Defendant requests to go forward tomorrow with preliminary hearing.
No use or possession of alcohol. No frequenting establishments who serve or sell alcohol.

2:03 PM Defendant Ryan Michael Stack appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Ryan Reid makes special appearance with defendant.  Attorney Allison Cogbill in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Attorney Reid receives complaint, waives reading, requests preliminary hearing. 
State requests $2000 cash, no use or possession of alcohol, no frequenting bars. Cites deferred agreement in previous file. Prior FTA's.
Attorney Reid requests signature bond or lower cash bond of $200 to $300. Douglas County resident 16 years. Notes FTA's are dated.
Court makes statements. Court orders $5000 cash, conditions of no alcohol, no frequenting establishment where alcohol is sold.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 11:45 am.
